intro: Seseli libanotis subsp. majus, commonly known as the Greater Lebanon Seseli, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. It produces small white to pale yellow flowers and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
